official-title.#text: To provide for the sale or transfer of certain Federal lands in Nevada, and for other purposes.

header.#text: Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Te-Moak Tribe of Western Shoshone Indians of Nevada (Elko Band)

text.#text: Subject to valid existing rights, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the land described in subsection (b)—
are hereby declared to be held in trust by the United States for the benefit of the Te-Moak Tribe of Western Shoshone Indians of Nevada (Elko Band); and
shall be part of the reservation of that Indian tribe.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as generally depicted on the map as

text.#text: The land referred to in subsection (a) is the approximately 373 acres of land administered by the

quote.#text: Lands to be Held in Trust

quote.#tail: , dated September 30, 2008, and on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete a survey of the boundary lines to establish the boundaries of the land taken into trust under subsection (a).

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the
Land taken into trust under subsection (a) shall not be eligible, or considered to have been taken into trust, for class II gaming or class III gaming (as those terms are defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 4 of the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act

text.#text: traditional and customary uses;
stewardship conservation for the benefit of the Tribe;
mineral leasing;
residential or recreational development; or
renewable energy development.
The Tribe shall use the land taken into trust under subsection (a) only for—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an amount that is equal to the fair market value of the portion of the land, as determined by an appraisal.

text.#text: If the Tribe uses any portion of the land taken into trust under subsection (a) for a purpose other than a purpose described in subparagraph (A), the Tribe shall pay to the
the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions;
the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practices; and
any other applicable law (including regulations).

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall determine the fair market value of the land under paragraph (2)(B) based on an appraisal that is performed in accordance with—

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 102. Conveyance of land to county.
Sec. 201. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Te-Moak Tribe of Western Shoshone Indians of Nevada.
Sec. 202. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Fort McDermitt Paiute and Shoshone Tribe.
Sec. 203. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Shoshone Paiute Tribes.
Sec. 204. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Summit Lake Paiute Tribe.
Sec. 205. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the South Fork Band Council.
Sec. 206. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Reno-Sparks Indian Colony land.
Sec. 207. Transfer of land to be held in trust for the Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe.
